the master branch:
VALID_API_VERSIONS = ["3.0", "3.1", "3.2", "3.3", "4.0", "5.0", "6.0", "7.0"]

so, can you create a new tag with the new code?

when i run 'pip install facebook-sdk', i can install the newest package.

items.title: Release 4.0.0 to support after deprecation on 7/26/2020
items.body:
@martey please release the 4.0.0 version before upcoming July (2020).

A deprecation is due at facebook of the `v3.0` of their graph API on 26th July 2020. Thanks for maintaining the repository.

items.title: Fix simple typo: appplication -> application
items.body:
There is a small typo in docs/api.rst.
Should read `application` rather than `appplication`.

items.title: Deprecation warning due to invalid escape sequences in Python 3.8
items.body:
Deprecation warnings are raised due to invalid escape sequences in Python 3.8 . Below is a log of the warnings raised during compiling all the python files. Using raw strings or escaping them will fix this issue.

```
find . -iname '*.py'  | xargs -P 4 -I{} python -Wall -m py_compile {}

./facebook/__init__.py:101: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \d
  version_regex = re.compile("^\d\.\d{1,2}$")
```

items.title: This endpoint is deprecated since the required permission publish_actions is deprecated
items.body:
I try to publish a picture on one of my facebook page. It worked a few hours and now I have this error message : 

  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/facebook/__init__.py", line 223, in put_photo
    return self.request(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/facebook/__init__.py", line 313, in request

facebook.GraphAPIError: (#200) This endpoint is deprecated since the required permission publish_actions is deprecated

items.title: Maintenance of package
items.body:
Hello @martey ,

First of all thank you for library and your effort on it.

As I see there is minor activity in commits, but not so active as we would like to have.
So seems like active development on this library is finished and the maintaining of this package is abandoned. Last official release of package was on November 6, 2018.

Is there any person which you trust and he is interested in this library and he is ready to support this library(accept, review MRs, publish to PyPi etc)?

items.title: Project release schedule
items.body:
Hi and thanks for all your work on this repo.

Does this project have an official PyPI release schedule?

The Facebook Graph API version 3.2 has been public for several months now; however, version 3.2.0 of `facebook-sdk` has been unreleased since January 2019 despite it being `master`.  (I understand if that is due to material changes in the structure of the API responses.  But it would be nice to have at least an informal timeline of when 3.2.0 will be the latest PyPI version.)

items.title: Support for multiple files in Page feed
items.body:
Hello!
How to upload multiple files to a Page feed? In the [Doc](https://github.com/mobolic/facebook-sdk/blob/master/docs/api.rst) only an image upload appears and using the _put_photo_ method.

`graph.put_photo(image=open('img.jpg', 'rb'), message='Look at this cool photo!')`

I expected an option like this:

`graph.put_object(parent_object=facebook_uid, connection_name="feed", message="Sending mutiple files!", images=[image.jpg, image2.jpg])`

It would be possible?

items.title: get_object for adaccounts fails
items.body:
### Version of the SDK being used
facebook-sdk version: 3.0.0a0
### Expected Behavior
`GraphApi(token, version='2.12').get_object("/me", method="GET", fields="adaccounts.limit(1000){id,account_id,business,name,user_role,currency}")`
Retrieves the accounts associated to the token in the response
### Actual Behavior
`GraphApi(token, version='2.12').get_object("/me", method="GET", fields="adaccounts.limit(1000){id,account_id,business,name,user_role,currency}")`
After making this call, we get the following error:
`(#3) Application does not have the capability to make this API call.`
This error only happens with one particular client's token, our other client's tokens work as expected.
When we test the same token on Facebook GraphAPI Explorer, it works as expected, in only fails when making the call through this facebook-sdk
### Steps to Reproduce
get an instance of the GraphAPI class with the token of our client, and make a `get_object` call to retrieve the client's ad accounts.
`graphApi = GraphAPI(token, version='2.12')`
`response = graphApi.get_object("/me", method="GET", fields="adaccounts.limit(1000){id,account_id,business,name,user_role,currency}")`

items.title: Insecure Usage of temp file/directory in Facebook Marketing API libraries
items.body:
Hello, fellow developers! There seems to be an insecure part of the Instagram API libraries, as it's using temp file/directory.

The codes look like this below:
------------------------------------------------------------------
**docs_utils.py**
DocsDataStore.set('filename', '/tmp/python_sdk_docs.nlsv')
------------------------------------------------------------------

What is the potential risk of this? Is there any way to improve?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39898500/40903266-6cd4d600-6809-11e8-8e50-813ef0459eb3.png)

items.title: Insecure M5 hash function in Instagram API code
items.body:
Hello, fellow developers! There seems to be two insecure parts in the Instagram API codes, as it's using MD5 hash function.

The two parts look like this below:
----------------------------------------------------------------
    def __init__(self, username, password, debug=False, IGDataPath=None):
        m = hashlib.md5()
        m.update(username.encode('utf-8') + password.encode('utf-8'))
----------------------------------------------------------------
    def generateDeviceId(self, seed):
        volatile_seed = "12345"
        m = hashlib.md5()
        m.update(seed.encode('utf-8') + volatile_seed.encode('utf-8'))
        return 'android-' + m.hexdigest()[:16]

What are the potential risk of this? Is there anyway to improve?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39898500/40902303-2654560e-6806-11e8-83d5-6ad09c875e48.png)

items.title: SDK does not return all places
items.body:
### Version of the SDK being used

3.0.0a0 (pip list shows that)

### Expected Behavior

Such code:
fb_accesstoken = fb.GraphAPI().get_app_access_token(cg.app_id,cg.secret)

graph = fb.GraphAPI(fb_accesstoken, version="2.11")

coordinates = '55.760007,37.665491

places = graph.search(type='place',
                      center = coordinates,
                      distance = 500)

Should return the same result as pasting:

search?type=place&center=55.760007,37.665491&distance=500

into Graph API explorer:

https://developers.facebook.com/tools/explorer/?method=GET&path=search%3Ftype%3Dplace%26center%3D55.760007%2C37.665491%26distance%3D500&version=v2.11

### Actual Behavior

However, the result in Python ignores the first line of result:

    { "name": "Gazgolder club",
      "id": "431917656900531"
    },

### Steps to Reproduce

Are described above

items.title: GraphAPIError: (#100) param X must be an array
items.body:
### Version of the SDK being used
2.0 and FB Api 2.7

### Expected Behavior
When I try to post a photo with `put_object` with `tags` as well as when I try to post to `feed` with `attached_media` (to create a post with multiple photos) I expect great success.

### Actual Behavior

The error: 

> GraphAPIError: (100) param attached_media must be an array.

When I examine the `post_data` being used, it looks to correctly be trying to pass an array.

For example:
```
{'access_token': '...', 'caption': '...', 'attached_media': [{'media_fbid': u'1234'}, {'media_fbid': u'1234'}, {'media_fbid': u'1234'}, {'media_fbid': u'1234'}]}
```

### Steps to Reproduce

The photo/tags is easier to try. This works with the exception of the tags parameter, which gives similar error to the above.
```
api.put_object(parent_object='me', connection_name='photos', url=image_url, caption=caption, tags=[{'tag_uid':1234}])
```
The tags parameter is shown at: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/page/photos/

At first I thought maybe I was using a specific endpoint incorrectly, but then when I encountered it again I knew it was a more general problem with my usage or the SDK.

items.title: Version number should be in the following format: #.# (e.g. 2.0).
items.body:
### Version of the SDK being used
facebook-sdk-2.0.0

### Expected Behavior
Able to initiate a Graph object for version 2.10 of the API

### Actual Behavior
facebook.GraphAPIError:  Version number should be in the following format: #.# (e.g. 2.0).

### Steps to Reproduce
import facebook

graph = facebook.GraphAPI(access_token='xx', version='2.10')



Looks like the regexp to check the version number needs to be updated to support #.## instead of just #.#.

items.title: Add test users support
items.body: Adding methods to get and manipulate test users would allow the sdk's users to more easily create tests by making test user operations more accessible. Implementing this feature would also allow us to write better and cleaner tests. I propose implementing a get_test_users method, an add_test_user method, and remove_test_user method.

Can't attach image & description when posting to wall

The new method `graph.put_object` doesn't offer to attach `image` & `description` properties as `**kwargs`.
Regarding this, the previous method , also functioned without problems ( `graph.put_wall`) , but also `image` & `description` properties were not registered when sharing to wall.

Don't know if this is a problem with the library or with new changes in the facebook Graph API ?

items.title: OAuth with API version specific scopes will return error of unknown scope.
items.body:
### Version of the SDK being used
None. 

### Expected Behavior
While OAuth with scopes specific to concrete API version lib should user auth link like:
`https://www.facebook.com/v2.9/dialog/oauth?...`, with API version prefix.

### Actual Behavior
Lib didn't allow to specify API version while OAuth and use link like:
`https://www.facebook.com/dialog/oauth?...`

### Steps to Reproduce
While auth with scope "business_management" Facebook responds with error of unknown scope.
`https://www.facebook.com/dialog/oauth?...`

__Using travis config FACEBOOK_APP_ID__
With errors:
`https://www.facebook.com/dialog/oauth?scope=business_management&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%2Ffacebook%2Fcallback%2F&client_id=198798870326423`

Without error:
`https://www.facebook.com/v2.9/dialog/oauth?scope=business_management&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%2Ffacebook%2Fcallback%2F&client_id=198798870326423`

items.title: Support GraphAPI versions > 2.7
items.body:
### Version of the SDK being used

2.0.0

### Expected Behavior

Should be able to specify a valid GraphAPI version (currently, that's 2.9), and get a proper `GraphAPI` instance:

```python
> api = GraphAPI(auth_token, version='2.9')
#yay!
```

### Actual Behavior

```python
> api = GraphAPI(auth_token, version='2.9')
GraphAPIError: Valid API versions are '2.1', '2.2', '2.3', '2.4', '2.5', '2.6', '2.7'
```

items.title: Support for Python 3.6
items.body:
### Version of the SDK being used
```bash
$ pip freeze | grep face
facebook-sdk==2.0.0
```

### Expected Behavior
```python
>>> import facebook
>>> # the next line should not raise an error
>>> facebook.GraphAPI
>>> # yay!
```

### Actual behavior
```python
>>> import facebook
>>> # the next line should not raise an error
>>> facebook.GraphAPI
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'facebook' has no attribute 'GraphAPI'
```

### Steps to Reproduce
This *only* happens in Python 3.6. Watch this:

```bash
$ workon my-35-virtualenv
(my-35-virtualenv) $ python --version
3.5.2
(my-35-virtualenv) $ python
>>> import facebook
>>> facebook.GraphAPI
>>> # yay!
>>> exit(0)
(my-35-virtualenv) $ workon my-36-virtualenv
(my-36-virtualenv) $ python --version
3.6.1
(my-36-virtualenv) $ python
>>> import facebook
>>> facebook.GraphAPI
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'facebook' has no attribute 'GraphAPI'
```

This leads me to believe that python 3.6 changed how imports work. I'll do some research on 3.6 imports, but I wanted this issue to be known. From what I saw there aren't any issues here nor on the facebook developer forum that address this.

items.title: Facebook Token Refresh without user action
items.body:
My "Issue" is more a question than an issue. 

The Access Token has a duration of 60 days. And after 60 days there should be a little "re-logging" or something like that and so can the Token be refreshed. 

Now my questions. 

Can we do that, without the user action? I mean, if we make a request (e.g. /me/), will the token refreshed? 

And just in case, if the user died, can we update the token every 55 days or so, with some request? 

I'm using the Facebook-SDK for some App that works with death people. (I know, a bit creepy, but someone had to do it :) ) and that's why the question came. 

Maybe someone tried something like that.

items.title: get_object fails for objects with "?" in it (e.g. URLs with query string params)
items.body:
**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Call `get_object` on a URL with querystring parameters (e.g. http://fundraise.teamrubiconusa.org/fundraise/get-involved?cid=5643)

**Expected Outcome:**

Correct likes (currently: 20)

**Current behavior:**

Some other number.

**Notes:**

* `get_object` is directly putting the object ID into the URL. This is incorrect; the object ID can contain URL-relevant characters, and so must be URL encoded.
* I've confirmed that if the *user* URL encodes the ID, that things are fixed. `get_object` should do this for the user, I believe.

items.title: Facebook API rate limit handling
items.body:
As stated in Facebook documentation [rate limiting](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/advanced/rate-limiting/) entry, Facebook will return a X-App-Usage header if the API usage is too high due to get requests, time of these requests or cputime consumed by these requests.

Is there any way to handle rate limit with the SDK? Or a way to get these values from the SDK?

items.title: GraphAPIError: (#200) The user hasn't authorized the application to perform this action
items.body:
I am using python2.7 and facebook-sdk--2.0.0. I have obtained my short/long lived token from facebook. When I do not specify a version it uses the default version which is 2.0 and it works fine and posts successfully on the page wall.

I changed to version to 2.5 and with that, I started getting the following error message.

```
 return self.api.put_wall_post(msg, attachment=kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/facebook/__init__.py", line 163, in put_wall_post
    **attachment)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/facebook/__init__.py", line 144, in put_object
    method="POST")
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/facebook/__init__.py", line 272, in request
    raise GraphAPIError(result)
GraphAPIError: (#200) The user hasn't authorized the application to perform this action
```

**Code**

```
attachment = {'link': 'www.foo.bar/view/foobar', 'picture':'www.foo.bar/foobar.jpg'}
api = facebook.GraphAPI(access_token=self.cfg['page_access_token'], version=2.5)
api = put_wall_post("my page post", attachment=kwargs)  # this fails.
```

```

api = facebook.GraphAPI(access_token=self.cfg['page_access_token'])
api = put_wall_post("my page post", attachment=kwargs) # Works
```

**Token Information**
**Scopes:** `manage_pages, business_management, publish_actions, public_profile`

**Origin** `Web`

**Valid**  `True`

**Expires** `Never`

**Issued**  `1463252518 (about 4 months ago)`

How can I fix the problem for v2.5 or what I might be doing wrong?

items.title: How to get my Own Facebook Posts using Facebook SDK?
How to access status message
items.body:
Hi
I need to access my last status message of my wall. How to use get_object to access status ?
Ex: to post on wall:  
def main():
  # Fill in the values noted in previous steps here
  cfg = {
    "page_id"      : "VALUE"
    "access_token" : "VALUE" 
    }

  api = get_api(cfg)
  msg = "Hello, world!"
  status = api.put_wall_post(msg)

def get_api(cfg):
  graph = facebook.GraphAPI(cfg['access_token'])
  # Get page token to post as the page. You can skip 
  # the following if you want to post as yourself. 
  resp = graph.get_object('me/accounts')
  page_access_token = None
  for page in resp['data']:
    if page['id'] == cfg['page_id']:
      page_access_token = page['access_token']
  graph = facebook.GraphAPI(page_access_token)
  return graph

Similarly, How can I read from wall ?
Please help

items.title: How to add flags to requests?
items.body:
Hi there, 

Thanks for this nice library :-) I've got a question regarding how to add flags in the requests. There are some calls, for example `/likes`, that will only show `total_count` if the flag `summary` is set to true. Check [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/v2.7/object/likes](this) documentation.

How can I add that flag to get the total likes count and not have to do it myself fetching and counting all the likes? I have tried:

`f.get_connections("post_id", 'likes', fields='total_count')`
`f.get_connections("post_id", 'likes', fields='summary,total_count')`
`f.get_connections("post_id", 'likes', fields='total_count', flags='summary')`
`f.get_connections("post_id", 'likes', fields='summary,total_count', flags='summary')`

but none gives me the count I want. Thanks a lot!

items.title: Logout no longer working in Flask example
items.body: Since the update of FB sdk 2.7, /logout no longer logs out. There is a console error message "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'accessToken' of null all.js:88"

items.title: The request() function just use the old version of Graph API
items.body:
I suspect an issue in request()

```
 response = requests.request(method or "GET",
                                        FACEBOOK_GRAPH_URL + path,
                                        timeout=self.timeout,
                                        params=args,
                                        data=post_args,
                                        proxies=self.proxies,
                                        files=files)
```

I think this function should use the version field, which one is defined as the parameter self.version. Otherwise, this function will use the old version number to request data from facebook server. So I advise modify it like this:
`response = requests.request(method or "GET",
                                        FACEBOOK_GRAPH_URL + self.version + "/" + path,
                                        timeout=self.timeout,
                                        params=args,
                                        data=post_args,
                                        proxies=self.proxies,
                                        files=files)`

items.title: issue posting image to page as page owner
items.body:
I suspect an issue in request()

```
    if self.access_token:
        # If post_args exists, we assume that args either does not exists
        # or it does not need `access_token`.
        if post_args and "access_token" not in post_args:
            post_args["access_token"] = self.access_token
        elif "access_token" not in args:
          args["access_token"] = self.access_token

   try:
        response = requests.request(method or "GET",
                                    FACEBOOK_GRAPH_URL + path,
                                    timeout=self.timeout,
                                    params=args,
                                    data=post_args,
                                    proxies=self.proxies,
                                    files=files)
```

I think args and post_args got confused. when I pass access_token as kwargs to request (via put_photo) it gets assigned to data via post_args, I think it needs to get into params via args, but it never gets into args

the problem is that when you want to post to a page as the page owner you need to use a page token (retrieved via me/accounts), not the regular user token

I only got it working directly setting the access_token attr on the graph instance, I don't think that is ideal though: 

```
    graph.access_token = page_token                                                                                 
    res = graph.put_photo(image=open(img, 'rb'), album_path="%s/photos" % id_, message=msg)
```

=> only after this it did post as page owner, e.g.
https://www.facebook.com/awesomereadingbob/

thanks
Bob

Is it possible using the "since" parameter in order to filter the posts after a specific date/time? How this parameter could be accomplished by the facebook-sdk? Thank you very much.

items.title: Graph API version 2.0 is deprecated in August 2016
items.body: The default version should be changed to > 2.0, IMO.

items.title: Use keepalive
items.body:
Using keepalive means that the TCP and SSL sessions do not have to be restarted for each request. This significantly reduces latency, particularly from locations such as Australia (200ms ping time to graph.facebook.com)

This can easily be achieved by using requests.Session

items.title: Maintype was not text, image, or querystring
items.body:
When trying to get posts of a page, you use this endopoint: pagename?fields=posts.limit(10)
Most of the posts are of this type:

``` json
      {
        "message": "Elle va faire battre votre ❤️ ! #EMEHARI #PlageDeLaBastille",
        "created_time": "2016-05-22T12:54:14+0000",
        "id": "103666283041018_1048666508540986"
      }
```

But some have one field more:

``` json
{
  "created_time": "2016-03-13T16:00:44+0000",
  "message": "E-MEHARI \"styled by Courrèges\" a électrisé le Salon de Genève !",
  "story": "Citroën added 4 new photos.",
  "id": "103666283041018_994707227270248"
}
```

When trying to retrieve Citroen.France 's last 50 posts, I get this error because of this field:

``` bash
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "myproject/myfacebookapiclient.py", line 21, in get_page_posts
    page_posts = graph.get_object(page_id, **args)
  File "myproject/src/facebook-sdk/facebook/__init__.py", line 106, in get_object
    return self.request(self.version + "/" + id, args)
  File "myproject/src/facebook-sdk/facebook/__init__.py", line 272, in request
    raise GraphAPIError('Maintype was not text, image, or querystring')
facebook.GraphAPIError: Maintype was not text, image, or querystring
```

I printed the header, and it looks like this:

``` json
{  
   "Content-Length":"108",
   "X-FB-Trace-ID":"H8Vc/+RKGp2",
   "Expires":"Sat, 01 Jan 2000 00:00:00 GMT",
   "X-FB-Rev":"2349332",
   "Connection":"keep-alive",
   "Pragma":"no-cache",
   "Cache-Control":"private, no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate",
   "Date":"Mon, 23 May 2016 09:29:08 GMT",
   "Facebook-API-Version":"v2.6",
   "Access-Control-Allow-Origin":"*",
   "Content-Type":"text/html",
   "X-FB-Debug":"R79ZCTpQx1n51dpXygxmEBADxwEWZxLbrEp8TcxDBLaRGYIPLOfwg9NmFMmN/oT4U6ixSauuDmV8MHnshQbr6Q=="
}
```

It looks like it's a new feature from Facebook, that the if/elif/else loop of the **init**.py file is not handling the way the API explorer is [for example](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/explorer/145634995501895/?method=GET&path=Citroen.France%3Ffields%3Dposts.limit%2850%29&version=v2.6)

items.title: request method does not use explicit Graph API version
items.body:
`graph.request()` does not pass the api version in the way facebook expects it to, for version 2.6 at least.

explicitly:

graph.request does: `https://graph.facebook.com/<path>?<args>` etc.
Facebook expects: `https://graph.facebook.com/<VERSION>/<path>?<args>` etc.

The bug might be different but this is what I deduced so far.
Thanks!

items.body:
Thanks for your useful facebook-sdk in advanced!

When I tried to upload a image to facebook using  `put_photo` method, I've got `GraphAPIError: (#1) An unknown error occurred`.

I search the internet and found out that in the tutorial `image=open('img.jpg')` should become `image=open('img.jpg','rb')`. After adding `'rb'`, I can successfully upload the image to facebook.

Could you please check if the tutorial is wrong, thanks!

items.title: TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'version'
items.body:
I am using Python 2.7 and I'm trying the Facebook SDK for the first time.  Using

   sudo pip install facebook-sdk

I was able to install a version of the Python Facebook library.  Using `pip show facebook-sdk | grep Version` I identified this as version `0.4.0`.  I tried a simple example from the [reference api](https://facebook-sdk.readthedocs.org/en/latest/api.html)

```
import facebook
graph = facebook.GraphAPI(access_token='your_token', version='2.2')
```

The Facebook [Graph Explorer](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/explorer/) online gives acess tokens.  The API versions now go up to the current version **2.5**.  Does **facebook-sdk** go that far yet?  In any case, the error message suggests there is no `version` keyword:

```
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'version'
```

The code works without any `version` keyword.  Which one am I using then?

items.title: Unable to pass parameters to get_object(s)
items.body:
The get_object(s) functions accept an **args parameter, but you pass it to the "args" of request function. This is bad because that array can't be used.

Atm if you use this code:

```
profile = graph.get_object('me', args={'fields': 'email,name'})
```

you will add only garbage into the request:

```
{'args': {'fields': 'email'}, 'access_token': 'myaccesstoken'}
```

Please accept this PR.

https://github.com/pythonforfacebook/facebook-sdk/pull/252

Hi,

I downloaded the python facebook sdk from the site https://pypi.python.org/pypi/facebook-sdk at the link https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/f/facebook-sdk/facebook-sdk-0.4.0.tar.gz

profile = graph.get_object("me")
print profile['email']

It doesn't work as it throws a KeyError, since email isn't found in profile. 

(1) I am using a test login profile to login to the facebook account and I know for sure that this account has an email address and I gave permission to share the email address to the app when logging for the first time. 

(2) On the JavaScript SDK side, I am also passing "email" to the scope as shown below:
     scope="email,public_profile" 
in the fb:login-button scope.

which is what the facebook sdk docs suggests that I do to obtain email.

In spite of (1) and (2), still the profile obtained doesn't have the email address. Any idea what could be the root cause and the fix?

Thanks,
Karthik

items.title: Mention Python 3 support in setup.py
items.body:
`setup.py` should include the following classifier, so that PyPI and [caniusepython3.com](https://caniusepython3.com/) would list it as having Python 3 support:

`'Programming Language :: Python :: 3'`

(Note: this is not the same as mentioning `3.3`, as the file currently does. It needs to also mention just `3`)
